metadata.title: CVE-2022-1652 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Linux Kernel could allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code on thesystem, caused by a concurrency use-after-free flaw in the bad_flp_intrfunction. By executing a specially-crafted program, an attacker couldexploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial ofservice condition on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1652` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1082.89').
linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
